briefdescription.para: Load magnetic field data and prepare parameters.

detaileddescription.para: This function fills the relevant magnetic field offload struct with parameters and allocates and fills the offload array. Sets offload array length in the offload struct.
The offload data has to have a type when this function is called as it should be set when the offload data is constructed from inputs.
This function is host only.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to pointer to offload array

briefdescription.para: Free offload array and reset parameters.

detaileddescription.para: This function deallocates the offload_array.
This function is host only.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to pointer to offload array

briefdescription.para: Initialize magnetic field data struct on target.

detaileddescription.para: This function copies the magnetic field parameters from the offload struct to the struct on target and sets the magnetic field data pointers to correct offsets in the offload array.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to data struct on target

memberdef.argsstring: (real *psi, real r, real phi, real z, real t, B_field_data *Bdata)
memberdef.name: B_field_eval_psi

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the poloidal flux psi at the given coordinates. The psi is exactly as it appears in Grad-Shafranov equation.
This is a SIMD function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer where psi [V*s*m^-1] value will be stored
pointer to magnetic field data struct

simplesect.para: Non-zero a5err value if evaluation failed, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (real psi_dpsi[4], real r, real phi, real z, real t, B_field_data *Bdata)
memberdef.name: B_field_eval_psi_dpsi

briefdescription.para: Evaluate poloidal flux psi and its derivatives.

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the poloidal flux psi and its derivatives at the given coordinates. The psi is exactly as it appears in Grad-Shafranov equation.

The values are stored in the given array as:
psi_dpsi[0] = psi
psi_dpsi[1] = dpsi/dr
psi_dpsi[2] = dpsi/dphi
psi_dpsi[3] = dpsi/dz
This is a SIMD function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer for storing psi [V*s*m^-1] and its derivatives
pointer to magnetic field data struct

simplesect.para: Non-zero a5err value if evaluation failed, zero otherwise

briefdescription.para: Evaluate normalized poloidal flux rho and its psi derivative.

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the normalized poloidal flux rho at the given coordinates. The rho is evaluated from psi as:
where $\psi_0$ is psi at magnetic axis and $\psi_1$ is psi at separatrix.
This is a SIMD function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer where rho value will be stored
poloidal flux from which rho is evaluated
pointer to magnetic field data struct

simplesect.para: Non-zero a5err value if evaluation failed, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (real rho_drho[4], real r, real phi, real z, B_field_data *Bdata)
memberdef.name: B_field_eval_rho_drho

briefdescription.para: Evaluate normalized poloidal flux rho and its derivatives.

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the normalized poloidal flux rho at the given coordinates. The rho is evaluated from psi as:
where $\psi_0$ is psi at magnetic axis and $\psi_1$ is psi at separatrix.

The values are stored in the given array as:
rho_drho[0] = rho
rho_drho[1] = drho/dr
rho_drho[2] = drho/dphi
rho_drho[3] = drho/dz
This is a SIMD function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer where rho and its derivatives will be stored
pointer to magnetic field data struct

simplesect.para: Non-zero a5err value if evaluation failed, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (real B[3], real r, real phi, real z, real t, B_field_data *Bdata)
memberdef.name: B_field_eval_B

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the magnetic field at the given coordinates.

The values are stored in the given array as:
B[0] = BR
B[1] = Bphi
B[2] = Bz
This is a SIMD function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to array where magnetic field values are stored
pointer to magnetic field data struct

simplesect.para: Non-zero a5err value if evaluation failed, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (real B_dB[15], real r, real phi, real z, real t, B_field_data *Bdata)
memberdef.name: B_field_eval_B_dB

briefdescription.para: Evaluate magnetic field and its derivatives.

detaileddescription.para: This function evaluates the magnetic field and its derivatives at the given coordinates.

The values are stored in the given array as:
B[0] = BR
B[1] = dBR/dR
B[2] = dBR/dphi
B[3] = dBR/dz
B[4] = Bphi
B[5] = dBphi/dR
B[6] = dBphi/dphi
B[7] = dBphi/dz
B[8] = Bz
B[9] = dBz/dR
B[10] = dBz/dphi
B[11] = dBz/dz
B[12] = dBR/dt
B[13] = dBphi/dt
B[14] = dBz/dt
This is a SIMD function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to array where the field and its derivatives are stored
pointer to magnetic field data struct

simplesect.para: Non-zero a5err value if evaluation failed, zero otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Returns magnetic axis Rz-coordinates at given toroidal angle.

parameterdescription.para: pointer where axis R and z [m] values will be stored
pointer to magnetic field data struct

detaileddescription.para: This is an interface through which magnetic field data is initialized and accessed. Reading e.g. from disk is done elsewhere.
To add a new magnetic field instance, make sure these functions are implemented and called from this interface, and that B_field.h contains enum type for the new instance.

The interface checks which instance given data corresponds to from B_field_offload_data.type and B_field_data.type from the structure that is given as an argument, and calls the relevant function for that instance.
